title: feature request: What is the healtcheck path for selfhosting?
body:
### Checklist

- [x] I checked that this feature has not been requested before
- [x] I checked that this feature is not in the "Not planned" list
- [ ] This feature will benefit the majority of users

### Problem Description / Use Case

When self-hosting, during auto deployments, there should be some healthcheck path just to tell the server that everything was built right and can work as it should.

### Proposed Solution

Described in the description.
author: oleglucic

title: feature request: ‚ÄúContribution Streams‚Äù should have a different label
body:
### Checklist

- [x] I checked that this feature has not been requested before
- [x] I checked that this feature is not in the "Not planned" list
- [x] This feature will benefit the majority of users

### Problem Description / Use Case

Mediafusion contribution streams have the same label as debrid streams.

### Proposed Solution

Mediafusion contribution streams should have a denomination different to ‚ÄúRD‚ö°Ô∏è‚Äù
author: Inferno-hash

comments.body:
if you use the torrentio format, it shows the indexer it was from, and if it was a contribution stream, it would say contribution streams. 

Why should contributions streams have a different denomination, are they not still debrid streams?

> if you use the torrentio format, it shows the indexer it was from, and if it was a contribution stream, it would say contribution streams.
> 
> Why should contributions streams have a different denomination, are they not still debrid streams?

Yes, you‚Äôre right. A few days ago I was playing a contribution stream and it was lagging a bit too much so I thought it was sourced from another streaming website, but they were indeed debrid streams. Sorry for the confusionüôè.

title: feature request: show debrid downloads
body:
### Checklist

- [x] I checked that this feature has not been requested before
- [x] I checked that this feature is not in the "Not planned" list
- [x] This feature will benefit the majority of users

### Problem Description / Use Case

Add option to display debrid download history to play files you've downloaded.

### Proposed Solution

Add this as an option, I've seen it on kodi addons. Think torrentio has the option too.
author: kodi-lover

comments.body: This addon is an aggregator of other addons. It doesn't make sense to add debrid logic to it.

title: feature request: Webdav streams?
body:
### Checklist

- [x] I checked that this feature has not been requested before
- [x] I checked that this feature is not in the "Not planned" list
- [x] This feature will benefit the majority of users

### Problem Description / Use Case

Thank you for this wonderful add-on. 
I used Davio in the past to add streams I have stored on a webdav service. These are mainly files from private trackers that aren't available anywhere else. Unfortunately this add-on is not actively developed anymore and doesn't seem to work anymore.
I was wondering if webdav support could be added to this add-on? I don't know how difficult that is, so if it is too much work please close this request.



### Proposed Solution

Integrating webdav support through Davio if possible.
author: keinflausaus

comments.body:
This addon is meant to gather streams from other addons. It's not meant to gather streams on its own. 

While I could theoretically add my own "addon" to the list which sources streams from your debrid account, its out of scope for this project.

Unfortunately, this won't be added. If another addon is developed for this, you can add it as a custom addon to AIOStreams.

I see. Thank you for your response : )

title: fix: speed up stream objects creation
body:
Hi, thank you for the great plugin. 

I noticed it took some time to populate the streaming links when used with mediaflow-proxy. Therefore I propose a small change to make the experience a bit more seamless.
author: nqkdev

title: Easynews streams gone
body:
Both Easynews and Easynews+ do not appear with 1.5.1

edit:  Spoke too soon.  They do load, but seem to only do so if nothing else does.  I do have them as last priority.
author: Dadkins918

comments.body:
Is there anything in the logs? 

They should load regardless. The priority in the addon section only affects sorting if you choose to sort by addon.

title: Mediafusion results do not show whether its cached or uncached
body: Mediafusion results are unclear on whether the result is something that is cached or uncached, can this be fixed please? Thanks.
author: ragmehos

comments.body:
I'll look into it. Thanks for reporting. 

Just for some more information, which formatter were you using, and were you using the latest release or using the latest commit?

Was mediafusion added through the mediafusion option or the custom addon option?

The issue seems to be when passing a custom URL for mediafusion, its not reporting whether its cached or not. If I remove the custom mediafusion URL, seems to work as expected. 

Was added through mediafusion option. Latest release. Formatter used was torrentio.

I will file a separate issue but custom addons dont work - but unsure how to debug that - any specific information that is required for a custom addon to work as expected?
Also are you on any other platform thats easier to chat? Found a few other issues that wanted to chat through.

When you say its not reporting its cached, do you mean theres no [RD+] or [RD download] at all? 

If you use more than 1 custom addon, it only uses the 1st one you entered and repeats that for however many custom addons you added. I have fixed this, but I haven't pushed a new release since ive been working on implementing the 2nd half of a custom formatter. 


Is it possible for you to deploy the addon using the latest commit, using either Render or from source and try again? 


I will also look into this once im done with the custom formatter.

Yeah contact me on discord, viren_7 

will be easier.
